### Psychological Risk Assessments Services Tender

#### Request for Proposal

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) Atlantic Region is soliciting bids for Psychological Risk Assessments Services from qualified providers. The selected contractor will provide services for offenders housed at the Nova Institution for Women.

#### Description

* Language of work: English
* Estimated quantity of commodity: as per solicitation document
* Duration of Contract: April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025 with option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods

#### Objectives

* Provide psychological risk assessment services to offenders, as requested by the Project Authority, at Nova Institution for Women as a psychologist
* Conduct assessment interviews, administer all psychological tests, interpret test results, and review offender files
* Provide reports and updates to the Project Authority and designees
* Consult with the Project Authority to ensure that all psychological practices are consistent with the relevant and most current legislation, practice standards, and policies

#### Required Deliverables

* Conduct risk assessments for offenders using the Static-99R and a clinician-rated actuarial measure
* Develop comprehensive psychological risk assessment reports
* Provide regular updates and reports to the Project Authority and designees
* Participate in meetings as a consultant, including case conferences and other related activities
* Participate in CSC training, including orientation to CSC and CSC’s risk assessment requirements
* Provide consultation services for the resolution of CSC internal offender grievance and investigative processes

#### Evaluation Criteria

* Technical ability to conduct psychological risk assessments
* Experience working with offenders
* Ability to communicate effectively with project authorities and designees
* Compliance with legislation and regulations

#### How to Respond

* Interested suppliers must submit a bid in response to this Request for Proposal
* Bidders can obtain the complete solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada Buys/Tender Opportunities website
* A debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process can be requested by the bidder within fifteen (15) working days of receipt of the results

#### Contact Information

* Contracting Authority: Sylvie Gallant
* Telephone: 506-378-8724
* Email: [Sylvie.Gallant@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:Sylvie.Gallant@csc-scc.gc.ca).environ

The Government of Canada offers full or partial reimbursement of certain training and research-related expenses associated with grant, contribution, and contract agreements under the Government of Canada’s Contribution Program Plan.
